title.narrative: Yangon Film School - Advanced Filmmaking Courses

description.narrative: After almost thirteen years of offering a world-class training programme to aspiring Myanmar filmmakers the Yangon Film School in Myanmar - Myanmar's only film school - proposes to institutionalise its programme and implement transfer of ownership to local s. This goal requires strategic planning and a secure financial basis for the three-year period covered by the current proposal. By establishing YFS as a permanent school with a regular curriculum ideally within a national institution YFS will strengthen c ivil society by creating a creative intelligentsia that promotes human rights by giving a voice to the voiceless documenting social iniquities but also finding positive narratives that will contribute to Myanmar?s transition to a democratic state. The Yang on Film School's core activity is to strengthen film as a means of promoting diversity and democratisation. This continuation project comprises a programme of advanced filmmaking courses and outreach train-to-teach and on-the-job management training design ed to facilitate handover to local administration and ownership. The School?s training programmes will bring together ethnically diverse often disadvantaged talented and passionate young men and women in Myanmar with experienced professionals for intensive film training programmes held in Yangon and other sites across the country with the aim of transferring solid filmmaking skills thereby spearheading a growing community of film and media professionals that will promote peace security and the free flow of information.This proposal comes at a crucial juncture in Myanmar?s transition: here is an unprecedented opportunity to strengthen the country?s filmmakers as innovative civil society actors. This continuation project aims to consolidate and formalise the S chool?s curriculum and status both in Myanmar and identify and implement strategies for its financial and institutional sustainability in partnership with the Myanmar government that will ensure the School's sustainability as a permanent innovative resourc e at the hub of a diverse media culture.
